speech: A lone Jaffa walks through the forest. He anxiously looks around, starting at every sound he hears.
O'Neill appears from a bush behind the Jaffa, weapon raised and aimed at the Jaffa. Carter and Daniel approach him from other angles, their weapons also aimed at him.
I am Ryk'l, of the Goa'uld Moloc.
Teal'c approaches him and they stand face to face. O'Neill keeps a watchful eye on the surroundings as they talk.
I too will die free, brother.
He offers his hand in friendship, which Reiku accepts.
Teal'c of the Tau'ri, your legend proceeds you. Thank you for meeting me.
We have been told that there are many here who believe in the dream of freedom for all Jaffa.

A staff weapon blast suddenly hits Reiku in the back, killing him instantly, and SG-1 take up defensive positions behind a rock amid a barrage of blasts. Several Jaffa come out into the clearing, and a fire fight ensues between them and SG-1. Then a huge wave of staff weapon fire comes from the left of SG-1, aimed at the attacking Jaffa. O'Neill and Daniel look to where it is coming from with puzzled faces, as the fire destroys the Jaffa.
There is only one way to be certain. (shouting) Shal'kek Nem'ron!
SG-1 look into the smoke drifting past where they weapons fire came from.
SG-1 raise their weapons as they detect movement. 2 female Jaffa emerge from the smoke, staff weapons in the hands. The first woman speaks, gently.
Warriors of the Tau'ri, we mean you no harm.
Another female warrior joins them. Daniel looks on as three others join the group, making a total of six.
Teal'c and O'Neill narrow their eyes, as if considering their request.
A glider swoops overhead, as the female warriors and SG-1 are still in the clearing. Both O'Neill and Teal'c look up at the sound of the glider.
(to the female standing next to her) Shal'kek, tal'kree.
The warrior standing next to her leaves.
(To SG-1) The stargate will not be accessible for long, we must hurry.
The other female kneels beside one of the wounded Jaffa, and takes out a canister. She removes the symbiote from the Jaffa, placing it in the canister. SG-1 look on, horrified.
There's no time to explain here, please come with us.
They are SG-1 of the Tau'ri.
(quietly, to Teal'c) Hey, what's going on?
(gesturing to Mala) This one believes we should return to her planet, that one believes it would not be wise.
Please, we knew you'd be here.
Our intelligence network runs deep within the Jaffa of Moloc. We came to ask for help. I promise you will be safe.
O'Neill and SG-1 exchange glances, as if assessing the situation.
A group of four Jaffa women, two on horseback, are by the gate, and greeting the returning party of Jaffa and SG-1.
Our dwellings are this way, please.
Ah, y'know, we really should call home first, let the folks know where we are. It's past our curfew.
O'Neill nods to Carter, who is standing just behind him. She moves off to dial home.
(to Mala) Why have we brought them here?
(with slight aggravation in her voice) Why was I not told?
Daniel and Teal'c pick up on the uneasiness between Neith and Mala and exchange concerned looks.
Because we know you would disagree. Go ahead, tell Ishta of our success.
She mounts one of the horses, and rides off to the settlement. SG-1 watch her leave.

SG-1 and the Jaffa party are walking through a field, with a line of trees behind them. Carter is a few paces in front, with Daniel, Teal'c and O'Neill walking in a line behind her. Jaffa make up the front and rear of the group.
My knowledge of the Goa'uld Moloc is limited. However, I am unaware of any Goa'uld who would permit his women jaffa to be warriors.
They seem to be well trained.
All females receive training. They are expected to defend their home world with their lives if their men are called to battle.
I can't help but think of the ancient Greek amazon mythos.
They were female warriors who occasionally captured men from other tribes in order to mate with them.
Would often, um, would sometimes remove their right breasts so they could more easily fire a bow and arrow.
I see neither bow nor arrow.
Wait, you don't s'pose that's why they want us, do you?
You know, the three of us.
He gestures to Daniel, Teal'c and himself.
To...to mate with? No, no, I don't think so.
'Cos you know me, I'm all for helping people.

They walk into a campsite. There are a few large tents around the outside, some women are cooking over open fires. Some young children see them, and run away. All the women they pass eye them with distrust. Mala leads them to a large tent in the middle of the settlement.
You must forgive them, for many of the young this is the first time they have seen men.
A young woman, about thirteen, and an older woman watch SG-1 carefully. O'Neill looks around. A woman comes out of the main tent. She looks proud and solemn, with the look of a leader.
Ishta walks down the steps from her tent, and Neith comes out of the tent after her.
Well howdy Ma'am, it's nice to meet you.
She walks straight past him, to Teal'c.
I've heard so...actually I've heard nothing about you.
He trails off and she stands opposite Teal'c.
Teal'c, of Chulak. Former First Prime of Apophis. Shol'va who has become a legend.
O'Neill leans over to Daniel, who is standing next to him.
(to Ishta) I am no legend. I fight, as any true hearted Jaffa, for the freedom that we deserve.
He bows his head, and Ishta returns the nod. He then gestures to his team.
This is Daniel Jackson, Major Carter, and Colonel O'Neill.
Ishta goes over and stands in front of them.
I have asked you here so that I may propose an alliance.
That's a fine idea. We should sit, talk, nosh.
No alliance can be formed between the Tau'ri and those who would steal symbiotes from their brother and leave him to die.
He was no brother of mine. Just a murderer of innocent children!
Neith folds her arms, but bites her tongue.
She gestures, and a young woman comes and joins her, her head bowed.
This is Synak. This morning she laid on her deathbed. She reached the age of Prata three days ago.
Without the symbiote we procured this morning, she would be dead now.
She gestures again, and the young woman seen before comes forward, obviously wary. She comes and stands on the other side of Ishta.
This is Nesa. Younger sister to Neith. She is next to reach the age. Without a symbiote, she will die.
There is a pause as the seriousness of the situation sinks in.
Ishta sits a little higher than everyone else. Neith is sitting on her right side, Mala on her left. Carter sits opposite.
Thirty years ago, Moloc decreed that only male children would be allowed to live. Only they could strengthen his armies and lead him to victory in the war of the gods.
Well, aside from the obvious immorality, that doesn't make sense. How do you sustain a population of any gender without women?
The Jaffa lifespan is longer than humans. This could go on for a hundred years. Any female child is to be sacrificed in the ceremony of fire, immediately after they're born.
Settlement life continues around SG-1. O'Neill, Teal'c and Daniel wait for Carter to come out. Daniel opens a power bar.
Maybe they just feel more comfortable talking to Sam.
He takes the bar off Daniel.
So how did you start bringing them here?

As a temple high priestess, part of my duty is to keep record of births. And to preside over the ceremony of fire itself. (barely containing her anger) I could not sit back and watch my sisters being murdered and do nothing.
As high priestess I, along with my seconds Mala and Neith, are allowed relatively free access to the Chappa'ai of the worlds under Moloc's rule.
No one outside this camp knows you're doing this.
No. Our duties require us to attend to many missionary matters on various planets.
So you offer the parents of these children a chance for their daughters to live.
All but a few Jaffa under Moloc worship him religiously. Not even the parents can be trusted. The children have to be spiritied away, secretly, for fear of being reported to the Imperial Guard.
It is punishable by death to even question the rules of the god.
Over the moons we have succeeded in saving many from their birthright of death.
So you want our help to overthrow Moloc?
Ishta and Neith exchange glances, Ishta starts to smile.
Moloc is very powerful. His armies are vasts.
We have our ways. And some very powerful allies.
Forgive us, but our immediate goals are somewhat less ambitious.
It is an ongoing struggle to procure the symbiotes needed for our young to survive. We lost many of our warriors in these raids. It is said your weapons are formidable.
We also require sustenance. Food and supplies among our growing population are scarce.
We are proud warriors. We offer you our services and our knowledge in return. We have an extensive intelligence network among the Jaffa under Moloc.
What if I were to offer you an alternative.
To your reliance on the Goa'uld.
Neith, Ishta, and Mala exchange glances.
SG-1 discuss Carter's conversation inside the tent.
We've had success with it so far.
It hasn't been easy. Jaffa won't willingly give up their symbiotes, despite the fact it could ultimately free them.
Jaffa believe they will be weaker without them.
Thinking about it. They've suffered some horrible atrocities at the hands of the Jaffa who serve Moloc. It's easy to see why they don't have a problem killing a few of them to survive.
A Jaffa is taught it is more noble to die than to kill another.
Teal'c, these children have been genetically altered to depend on symbiotes and then has all access to them taken away. Their guardians believe that this is the only way for them to survive.
Then they will have to see that there is another way.
He leaves. O'Neill calls after him.
Give them the old Teal'c charm!
Several sculptures, similar to dream catchers, hang from branches around a clearing in the wood. Teal'c approaches, staff weapon in hand, and stops to look at one of the sculptures.
Each design represents an ideal that no warrior should ever forget.
Impressive that I did not sense your approach.
Is not stealthiness one of the first talents taught to a Jaffa soldier?
Teal'c turns to look at her.
You wish to talk me into succumbing to this experiment?
They walk together into the clearing.
Have you really the belief that this...tretonin is our way to freedom?

If it is successful it may be the first step. As long as Jaffa require symbiotes we will continue to be enslaved by the Goa'uld. The benefit a symbiote provides is not a Jaffa's true strength. And we as a people must begin to realise that sacrifices must be made if we are ever truly to be free.

They enter the training ground. More sculptures hang from the branches above. the are four stands around the outside of the clearing, with wooden staff weapons leaning against them. It is obviously a site for practising hand to hand combat.
This is where I come to kel-no-reem.
Much of our tradition and our way of life has been designed to instil our dependence on the Goa'uld.

You believe it is wrong that we kill Jaffa merely that children to live, but what is war for but the preservation of our children? We do not engage the defenceless or the weak. We always fight with honour, and those that die do not die in vain.
One day you will come across a Jaffa scout party that will not so easily be ambushed.
Then you doubt our abilities. Is that what this is about? You speak of progress, and shedding of the old ways, and yet you still think a woman needs your protection.
Ishta walks over to one of the stands and picks up two wooden training staffs.
May your limbs be more nimble that your tongue.
She throws one of the staffs to Teal'c and takes up a defensive position.

Teal'c looks at the staff, and takes off his jacket, ready for combat. Ishta removes her cloak. Ishta attacks, and Teal'c defends himself, with one hand behind his back. She lunges, and he ducks as her staff flies over his head. She continues the attack, with him rebuffing every move. Then he makes his attack, still only using one hand, with the other behind his back. Ishta defends herself well, twirling around to strike. Teal'c moves his staff up to block, and they lock staffs in mid air. Ishta suddenly falls to the ground, using her leg to trip Teal'c, who falls on his back. They both leap up, Ishta having dropped her staff and preferring to use her bare hands. She kicks him twice in the head, and grabs his staff.
Do not hold back or you will only anger me further!

Teal'c throws her off, and she does two back flips as he advances, picking up her staff blast on the last flip. They engage staffs again, Teal'c this time using both hands. The fight continues, with each having to defend as well as attack. Ishta's kicks manage to find their mark again, and she kicks him in the chest and head. He retaliates, grabbing both their staffs. Teal'c flips Ishta over his back, so thatshe is facing away from him. Before she can turn around, he grabs the staffs, forcing her into him and locking her there, the staffs against her throat.

You have proven yourself a worthy adversary, now hear me! If you say no to tretonin, it will only mean you have an unquenchable thirst for bloodshed and revenge, and that does not serve those who follow your leadership.
I sense no symbiote in you
Ishta grabs the staffs, and flips Teal'c over her back. He falls on his back on the ground.
You take this drug yourself and then conceal it? Your actions betray your words!
She goes to one of the sculptures, and tears it down from the branch it was hanging from. She tosses it to Teal'c who catches it.
Ishta address her people from the steps of her tent. SG-1 listen to her words as well.

No longer will we need to lose our sisters in battle. No longer will our daughters be dependent on symbiotes. Teal'c has taken the drug. He stands here before you as evidence. I am asking for four volunteers, to travel with me, to the Tau'ri, to test its effectiveness.
Several warriors begin looking around, or looking at floor, nervously. SG-1 look around as well. There are a few quiet murmurs, but no one steps forward.
Mala, I have made my decision.
Ha'ktyl needs you. You are our leader. I will go in your stead. It is my right as Kindra. You cannot say no.

She and two other warriors step forward to join Mala. Ishta smiles slightly, then looks over to Neith, who is standing next to Nesa. Neith looks down at the ground. Ishta walks over to her, and looks at her, then Nesa.
I'm told it's not without risk. But if there is one among us-
(interrupting) Never! That you would even consider this is an affront to all of us.
Neith walks away, taking Nesa with her. Daniel watches with interest. Ishta closes her eyes briefly, then addresses the crowd.
I cannot force her hand. (to Mala) I wish you well.
O'Neill, Carter and the four volunteers emerge from an active wormhole. They are met by Hammond, standing at the base of the ramp.
As Teal'c would say, undomesticated equines couldn't drag him away.
The leader of the Ha'ktyl wanted to learn more about the rebel Jaffa. We figured we could send updates on the progress of the tretonin treatment to Daniel through the MALP.
Kind of a PR thing, Sir.
(To the volunteers) I'm General Hammond. Welcome to Earth.
Teal'c and Ishta walk through a grassy field.
When you rose up against Apophis, did you leave behind someone that you loved?
My son and I have been reunited. He has become a great warrior and travels with my mentor Bra'tac spreading word of our cause.
And what of his mother? Does she sit at home, pining away for her hero?
You could not have known. She dies last year when her symbiote matured and she was unable to procure another.
Mala is lying in an infirmary bed, about to receive her first treatment.

It's being sustained. We've developed methods of keeping a symbiote alive for some time. As far as the tretonin, finding the right amount is going to be somewhat trial and error. We'll keep increasing the dose until we get the desired effect.
Mala nods. Fraiser leaves, leaving Carter and Mala alone. Carter sits beside her.
Not so much as you think.
Teal'c and Ishta continue their conversation.
The rebellion that I helped fuel has caused the Goa'uld to mistrust the Jaffa with their young.
I am speaking only of Drey'uac. She refused to take the life of another Jaffa, even to preserve her own. No matter what their beliefs may have been.
What are your memories of her?
She could be as fierce as the wind, or as gentle as the sunshine. And she never feared to be either.
I will always have a place in my heart for her.
Carter and Mala continue their conversation.
You are close to Colonel O'Neill.
Yeah. I like to think we have a special relationship.
I hope to one day have a special relationship.
Oh! No, no it's not like that.
Oh, uh, we aren't, you know, we don't...
I was speaking of the mutual respect you share.
Ishta and Teal'c continue their conversation.

I am from a world unlike yours Teal'c, where women aren't held in such high regard. My husband was a warrior of high station in Molloc's imperial guard. I was but one wife of many, still, as temple priestess I was afforded many luxuries to make up for my mistreatment.
What has become of your husband?
He was killed in battle, against a rival Goa'uld.

I was once a temple handmaiden. I fell in love with a young palace guard. Our relationship was forbidden because of our station. When it was discovered that I was to have his child, Moloc sentenced my beloved to death, and sacrificed my daughter before my eyes.
Ishta confides in Teal'c. They stand very close to each other.
When will the Goa'uld's thirst for conquest and bloodshed end?
A group of children play blind man's bluff. They laugh together, while in the background adults take care of the daily chores. Nesa comes and sits down on a log. She looks pensive.
My sister says I shouldn't talk to you.
Daniel comes to sit beside her.
You don't have to. I'll just sit here for a while. (pause) I'm Daniel.
She steals a glance in his direction, then quickly looks away. He looks over at her
Who were you talking to then?
No one. (pause) So how are you?
Daniel nods, and Nesa smiles. She looks at his face.
What are those on your face?
Uh, they're called glasses. They help me see better.
Why would you need to see better?
Because my eyes don't see as well as they should.
Daniel takes them off and puts them on her face.
She hands them back to Daniel, who puts them on.
Yeah, well they work differently for different people.
Perhaps you are in need of a symbiote.
Yeah, I'll just stick with the glasses.
Neith has told me that your people don't approve of our use of symbiotes for healing.
Well, it's a little more complicated than that. I just think there's a better way.
Neith does not want me to participate in your experiments.
Soon I will require a symbiote.
You don't sound very happy about that.
I will become a great warrior like Neith.
You know you can do that without a symbiote.
Mm-hmm. But, um, you didn't hear that from me.
Ishta and Teal'c have just finished a meal. Ishta pours Teal'c a drink from a large jug. The tent is filled with candlelight.
I have spoken more in two days than I have in many years.
They exchange long lingering glances in the silence.
Perhaps I should take my leave.
Ishta looks as if she id going to let him go, then she stops him for rising.
Thoughts of your wife still linger, that's understandable. But she's been gone now for over a year. There is no sin in taking comfort in another lonely soul, if you wish.
She moves forward, and they kiss.
A nurse attends Mala, then draws a curtain across as she leaves. Carte and Fraiser discuss her progress.
Mala's the only one not responding. Her white blood cell count is way down. If this keeps up she'll go into sepsis.
Continue to increase the tretonin levels. But she's already at double the doses of the others. I want to put her in isolation.
We had no guarantees going in. Some would say an 80% success rate isn't bad in a trial like this.
Not in the minds of the Jaffa.
We're not dome yet. We haven't even begun to explore the reasons why it might not be working in Mala.

Daniel is lying on his bed, asleep. Someone points a staff weapon at him at point blank range, and readies it for firing. The noise wakes him, and he rolls over to see the end of the weapon about two inches from his face.
Neith is holding the weapon. She is very angry and upset.
You had no right to speak to her.
I saved her from her birthright, and it will be the symbiote I procure that will save her once again. I've already lost two sisters, and I will not lose another one!
Okay, okay, you lost two sister, I'm sorry.

Ishta was able to save me, but she couldn't save the next two girls sired by my father. He was a Jaffa stationed high in the imperial guard. I swore that when I came of age no more of my sisters would die. When I heard that my mother had given birth to yet another female, I know what I had to do.
You should be proud of that.
My father discovered the rouse Ishta and I used to keep Nesa away from the fire. I had to kill him so we could escape.
Daniel looks quickly at the staff weapon still two inches from his head.
Well, don't you want to give Nesa a chance to live free of the Goa'uld?
She closes the staff weapon, the noise of which makes Daniel jump a little. Neith leaves.
Mala's vital signs are shown on a monitor. Nurses in the isolation room wear face masks, as does Carter as she talks to Mala.
You've moved me away from the others because you did not wish to frighten them.
(shaking her head) The truth is, you're not doing so well. You're more susceptible to infection in your condition.
How are the others responding to treatment?
An alarm starts to sound, and Mala's breathing becomes very laboured.
Fraiser and a nurse come over.
Fraiser checks the monitors. Mala continues to struggle to breathe.
We have to put her symbiote back.
If we don't you could die.
This must work if my people are to be free. If I continue to be enslaved by the Goa'uld I carry I am as good as dead.
She pauses to try and breathe.
Carter looks up at Fraiser. Fraiser looks back. Mala lies back on the bed.
Neith faces a group of warriors
She is no longer fit to lead us. She consorts with Teal'c. Her judgement has been clouded.
Our sisters have risked their lives for the experiment. Do you see no benefit if it works?
Even if the tretonin works, it merely places our dependence on the humans of Tau'ri-
Whom you also do not trust.
Who is to say their intentions are pure. Their leaders are men, they wish to sap our strength with this drug.
We are safe here at the moment, but if Moloc ever learnt that we were behind the raids on his Jaffa-

Our freedom lies on dominance over the Goa'uld. We must fight, so that we may use their symbiotes to our advantage. Only then will we control our own destiny. I wish to know, is I am to challenge Ishta's leadership, who will follow me?
The warriors consider for a moment. Another warrior enters, walking through the group to Neith.
Neith! You must come quick, it is Nesa.
Mala is unconscious. She has a nasal tube to help her breathe. Fraiser wheels in a glass chamber, with Mala's symbiote inside.

A nurse opens the top of the glass chamber, and Fraiser retrieves the symbiote. She places the symbiote inside Mala's pouch, with Carter looking on. O'Neill and Hammond watch from the observation deck, O'Neill squirming a little.
How long before we see some improvement?
Mala starts to gasp for breath again, and the lines on the monitor go flat. An alarm sounds.
She's coding! Start CPR, let's intubate. Give me 1 milligram epi, prep for defib!
Carter, Hammond and O'Neill watch as Fraiser's team start moving frantically about, trying to rescue Mala.
Nesa is lying on her bed, with Neith gently stroking her hair.
Be strong, sister. I will not fail you.
A group of warriors rush through the edges of the viallge. Daniel and Teal'c watch them pass.
(on horseback) Neith has claimed Jon es say ko!
Carter contacts Daniel and Teal'c through the radio.
Daniel, Teal'c, this is Sam, come in.
Daniel and Teal'c are rushing through the forest, following the crowd. Carter's message comes over the radio. Daniel stops to answer the message, while Teal'c goes ahead.
(into radio) Yeah, go ahead Sam, it's me, Daniel.
(over radio) We have some bad news.
Uh, things aren't going that well here either, what's up?

Neith falls to the ground. A staff weapon to readied for firing and pointed at her face. It is clear there has been a fight. Ishta is holding the weapon. The crowd have made a ring around the outside.
You dare intervene! She challenges me. It is my right!
It is your right to grant mercy.
He runs into the ring, out of breath.
Uh, look, I know this is not a good time for this, there never really is for something like this-
(still pointing the weapon and glaring at Neith) Speak!
All those present are clearly shocked.
The tretonin wasn't working. When they tries to reintroduce her symbiote...Look, I just want you to know, the other women are fine.
See what your weakness has brought. Nesa is in need of a symbiote.
Ishta withdraws her weapon, and offers her hand to Neith.
Neith takes Ishta's hand, gets up, and takes the staff weapon. She leaves. Ishta goes to follow her, but is stopped by Teal'c.
Do not make this mistake. Moloc will not allow this to continue.
How many warriors have to die?
Our sisters in your care will be returned safely. Or the two of you will be sacrificed!
Teral'c and Daniel turn round to find at least six warriors pointing staff weapons at them. The rest leave with Ishta.
Teal'c and Daniel are inside a tent, discussing options. Teal'c paces the room.
Look, I know you want to stop Ishta and the gang, but even if we could get out of here, we don't know where they went.
The tent opens, and Ka'lel and two other warriors enter.
She leaves. Daniel and Teal'c look at each other, then follow.
Ka'lel leads them into Neith's tent, where Nesa lies. Daniel looks to Ka'lel for an explanation.
I do not wish for someone else to die so that I might live. I do not want to take a symbiote.
Daniel goes to sit on the edge of her bed. He clears his throat.
Did you talk to your sister?
She would not listen. It is my right to decide, is it not?
I'm not sure. It should be.
We don't really know. We do know that it was partly a reaction to her own symbiote. It shouldn't happen to someone who was never implanted.
And the tretonin worked in others, did it not?
Do you know where Ishta and Neith have gone?
Teal'c and Daniel look at Ka'lel. She leaves, and Teal'c bows to Nesa before leaving as well. Daniel gets up and is the last to leave.
Jaffa lie scattered, dead and dying. Female warriors pick up staff weapons. Ishta and Neith survey the scene.
(to warriors on the ridge behind her) Shel nok anree!
(to Neith) We have been fortunate this day. More have died than needed to.
We have saved the life of my sister.
Ishta approaches one of the dying Jaffa. She removes her dagger from it's sheath, and is about to remove the symbiote when the Jaffa speaks to her.
Is the symbiote too near maturity?
(obviously shocked and upset) This Jaffa has the same wish for freedom as do we.
Then he should not fought along those that follow Moloc.
In the distance an injured Jaffa raises his head. A staff weapon lies within his reach.
How many others? that might have been our allies have we killed today?
She takes the knife from Ishta. The Jaffa in the distance has picked up the staff weapon, and shoots Neith in the back. Ishta turns round, pointing her weapon at the Jaffa.
He prepares to fire again, at Ishta, but is zatted by Teal'c, who runs over to Ishta with Daniel and Ka'lel close behind.
She is severely wounded. Her symbiote is damaged as well.
Ishta picks up the dagger again, but Teal'c grabs her wrist.
Ishta turns to look at Teal'c, anger filling her eyes. It begins to melt away though, turning to grief. She drops the dagger, and allows Teal'c to hold her.
O'Neill and Carter watch Neith from the observation deck. Fraiser monitors her vitals. Ishta and Teal'c look on from the end of the bed.
I don't know how much longer I can keep her alive. If we're going to administer the tretonin, it's now or never.
(to Ishta) You must speak to her.
Ishta moves up, and leans over Neith.
Neith opens her eyes, and looks around. She then looks at Ishta.
Then you sentence me to death.
I ask you to choose life.
Neith looks away. Ishta stands up.
She will not listen to me.
Well maybe she'll listen to her sister.
Nesa goes to stand next to Neith.

No. You betrayed me. Since before I can remember, you have taught me to believe in our freedom. You said that you would do anything so that you might protect. One day I will be a great warrior like you, but I am not yet. I still need you. I have chosen to live free. You must choose to take the tretonin if you are to continue to teach and protect me. Please, I do not wish you to die.
Neith slowly raises her hand, and gently strokes Nesa's face. She nods, and Nesa smiles, bending down to embrace her sister. Neith steals a glance at Daniel.
The stargate spins as it dials the address for Ha'ktyl. SG-1 are lind up on one side of the ramp, with Neith, Nesa, Ka'lel and Ishta on the other side, facing them.
(To Daniel, opposite her.) Will you come and visit?
My sister's developed quite an affection for you.
She glances up, smiling at Daniel, who smiles back. Teal'c can't resist a smile.
We are grateful to our new friends. On behalf of the Ha'kytl, I'd like to express our thanks.
Our medical team will be checking in on a regular basis. Be sure to take note of any symptoms that could a side effect of the tretonin.
You have trained us well in the use of the medicine.
The food and supplies you have provided will go far.
Well, if there's anything else you need, anything, just give us a call. Send us an email.
Just that not so many moons go by before we see you again.
Teal'c and Ishta draw into an embrace and kiss each other. O'Neill doesn't seem to notice that Ishta was not talking to him.
Oh, don't worry, I'm sure we'll be in...
The gate activates, and O'Neill notices the passionate embrace of Teal'c and Ishta.

Carter and Daniel look slightly embarrassed and leave the gateroom together. Neith and Nesa smile, turn around and head up the ramp. O'Neill raises his eyebrows, then nods and leaves as well. Teal'c and Ishta finish their kiss and Ishta walks up the ramp, leaving Teal'c at the base of the ramp, alone. At the top she turns and bows, before entering the wormhole. The wormhole disengages.
